intro: Ascocentropsis pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf rock cress, is a small, flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in dry, sunny environments. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
